1558038.folder: Park Avenue - East 59th Street, Manhattan, NY
1558038.title: Park Avenue - East 59th Street

714006f-a.text:
(1)
East 59th Street, south side, east from, but not including Park Ave. Shown on the extreme right, is a portion of the Anderson Galleries, which is at the S.E. corner of Park Ave.
July 11, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A portion of the same, in the opposite direction.
NEG #3686  July 11, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

714007f-a.text:
(1)
East 59th Street, north side, east from Park Ave. Shown at No. 111-113, just east of Park Ave., is the N.Y. Ass'n for the Blind. Prominently shown, is the new Bloomingdale Bros. Dept. Store Building, at the N.E. corner of Lexington Ave., with the old one extending eastward to Third Ave.
July 11, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, further eastward.
June 11, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

(1)
East 59th Street, north side, east from Park Ave. Shown at No. 111-113, just east of Park Ave., is the N.Y. Ass'n for the Blind. Prominently shown, is the new Bloomingdale Bros. Dept. Store Building, at the N.E. corner of Lexington Ave., with the old one extending eastward to Third Ave.

(2)

714008f.text:
59th Street, at the S.E. corner of Park Ave, Building shown is the Maennergesaugverein Arion (Known as Arion Hall) organized in
1854. occupied this building in 1887.
About 1890.

714009f-a.text:
East 59th Street, south side, west from Park Ave., showing at the S.W. corner of same (left), No. 500 Park Ave., the administrative offices of the Board of Education. In November 1936,the City of New York aoduired a 12-story structure (the former Elks clubhouse) at 102-14 Livingston Street, Brooklyn and will house these offices there after extemsive alterations ( 800,000). The edifice with the sloping roof is the Savoy Plasa Hotel and is on the east side of Fifth Ave. between 58th
and 59th Streets.
August 4, 1937.
L. Sperr.

714010f-a.text:
(1)
59th Street, west from Park Avenue. In the right background is
the Hotel Sherry-Netherland.
April 9, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same. The structure on the right is the Hotel Delmonico,(erected 1928) and is at the N.W. corner of Park Ave. Adjacent to same are four 5-story structures that will be demolished and replaced by a 2-story
atructure in the near future. They are Nos. 59 to 53.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

59th Street, west from Park Avenue. In the right background is

714011f-a.text:
East 59th Street, north side, west from Park to Fifth Aves., showing prominently at the latter point the Sherry Netherland Hotel. On the extreme right appears a portion of the Hotel Delmonico which is at the N.W. corner of Park Ave. Adjacent to same are four 5-story buildings, Nos. 59 to 53, that will be demolished and replaced by a new 2-story
structure.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Tho same from a different angle. Photographers vantage point is in
front of No. 57.
August 4, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

714012f-a.text:
(1)
59th Street, Park Avenue to Madison.
(Before reconstruction).
April 29, 1919.
(2)
Same, after reconstruction.
President Borough of Manhattan.

722284f-a.text:
500 Park Avenue, south west corner of 59th Street, showing the Hall of New York Board of Education.Manhattan.
Board of Education, N.Y.C.
dUDIT LINE IMPE ATIVE.  1920.

722285f-a.text:
502 Park Avenue, on N.w. corner of 59th Street.
Note building under construction immediately to the north. This building end the two small ones adjoining it on 59th Street are shortly to be demolished to make room for the 30-story
Hotel Delmonico.
June 1925.

722286f-a.text:
Park Avenue at N.W. corner of 59th Street, looking west on 59th
Street, showing the new Hotel Delmonico building.
In the background rises the tower of the new Hotel Sherry Netherland.
1928.
Brown Brothers, Photographers.
According to the New York Times of October 6, 1937, page 45, Nos. 59 to 53 East 59th Street (inclusive) will be demolished and replaced by a 2-story business structure. These buildings adjoin the Hotel Delmonico and are shown on the left of same.

722288f-a.text:
Park Avenue, north from 59th Street, showing building fronts along west side of the Avenue.
Note buildings have been demolished between 60th and 61st Streets.  This site will be occupied by  Christ Church (Methodist Episcopal) and the Park Avenue Tennis Club courts.
Buildings between 59th and 60th Streets are both quite new.
Late 1930

International News Photographs

722293f-a.text:
Park Avenue, south from 60th Street, showing excavation at N. W. corner of 59th Street where Hotel Delmonico is to be built, and old Arion Pe11 building (1887) on S. E. corner of 59th Street, as well as new Ritz Tower apartments on N. E. corner of 57th Street. Note traffic signal tower st 57th Street, the type about to be discontinued.
1926.
Brown Brothers, Photographer

722294f-a.text:
Park Avenue, south from 60th Street, showing faces of buildings on the
east side of the Avenue.
On the S. E. corner of 59th Street stands the old Arion Pall building.
The Ritz Tower rises at N. E. rorner of 57th Street.
Note New York Central building across the avenue down at 46th Street, and the dimly seen tops of the Chrysler and Chanin buildings.
1930.
Ewing Gallowey, Photographer.
